intro: Apodanthes minarum, commonly known as the mountain apodanthe, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apodanthaceae, a group of plants known for their unique, often parasitic relationships with other plants. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and its ability to thrive in arid and rocky environments. Its botanical features include a short, woody stem and small, clustered leaves. Due to its specialized habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
